summary.Title: Embedded Software Developer / Firmware Developer
summary.Presentation: Amfitech seeks an embedded software developer to further strengthen the core developer team, and become the next member of the “Amfitech family”, which currently consists of fourteen dedicated tech

JobPositionInformation.Purpose:
Amfitech seeks an embedded software developer to further strengthen the core developer team, and become the next member of the “Amfitech family”, which currently consists of fourteen dedicated tech developers. The overall daily goal is to cooperatively solving challenging development issues, and having fun doing it in a casual work environment.

 

About you:

You have a positive attitude and a professional curiosity that challenges known solutions, and you creatively join the team’s problem solving of challenges, often to which no known solution exists. You are eager to become a part of a team that handles all sorts and all sizes of tasks - some tasks need a lot of innovativeness; some less. Some are extremely complicated; others are straight forward. 

You thrive in a dynamic and developing environment, where you can challenge your skills and knowledge, without compromising with the quality. You are working well under know deadlines, and recognize the benefit of team work, and working together for the common goal. You are confident in communicating in English with both customers and team members. 
On a daily basis where dedication, commitment and quality awareness are key words, you will be met by customers individual technical challenges, and you want to support them getting the best possible technology solution for their particular problem.

 

Together with the development team, your primary tasks will be: 

➢ Develop embedded software for microcontrollers (often ARM based STM32 processor)
➢ Embedded digital signal processing, filter design, etc.
➢ Develop python and C# tools to support the embedded development
➢ Contribute to the development of tools and processes in connection with the team’s 
collective competencies 
➢ Specify and document solutions
➢ Sparring with the hardware team 

 

We imagine that you have a bachelor or master’s degree in electrical engineering and that you have at least three years of experience in embedded development on a high professional level. 
You have a personal interest in being up-to-date in the line of your professional field. Being an active and curious DIY, using your professional skills solving everyday non-work challenges is an absolute plus. A basic understanding of hardware is needed since many of these tasks are closely tied to hardware. 

 

About Amfitech: 

Amfitech is a privately held Danish product development company that has been in business for more than 20 years, with a strong focus in highly innovative technology development. We love big challenges. Cutting edge, never-before-seen projects on the limit of what’s possible is what motivates us. We are a strong partner when extra R&D capacity is needed, we have the capability to support the complete product development cycle from technology concepts to finished products, running high volume production, and our customers range from large international companies who are world leading within innovation, to local entrepreneurs developing first generation prototypes.

We have continuous focus on employee well-being and are very aware of delivering support for all new members of the “Amfitech Family”. Helping each other on a daily basis is deeply founded in the company culture, and so is professional and personal development of each employee. 
Amfitech is characterized by the employees and management teams’ technology passion, which results in a vision to deliver tomorrows technology solutions. Development competencies include hardware, embedded software (firmware), PC/Linux application software, mechanics, prototyping – and more.


The head office is placed in the dynamic and rapidly growing city of Vejle, Denmark, which is where the development team is situated, and from where new employees will work. The position is for 37 hours per week, and salary is according to your qualifications. 

 

Application and assessment: 

Questions, application and resume can be addressed to HR- and communication responsible Helena Munk, phone: +45 28 57 00 02 or email: hm@amfitech.dk
The position is open, looking to be vacated as soon as possible, which is why interviews are being arranged as fast as possible.


For more information about us, please visit www.amfitech.dk and www.amfitrack.com
